entities.description: A type of fraud that interferes with wire communications.
The fraudulent acquisition and use of a person's private identifying information.
Unauthorized access to data in a system or computer.
Theft or misappropriation of funds placed in one's trust.
Crimes involving the theft of property.
Destruction, damage, or vandalism of property.
Crimes related to the illegal possession, distribution, or manufacture of drugs.
Crimes involving the illegal possession, distribution, or manufacture of drug paraphernalia.
Crimes involving the distribution of obscene or pornographic materials.
Crimes related to unauthorized betting or wagering activities.
Crimes related to engaging in or promoting commercial sex acts.
Crimes involving the offering, giving, receiving, or soliciting of something of value to influence an action.
Crimes involving the illegal possession, use, or trafficking of weapons.
Crimes involving modern slavery, including commercial sex acts and forced labor.
The unlawful killing of another human without justification.
The unintentional killing of a person due to reckless or negligent actions.
The killing of a person in circumstances that allow for exoneration.
